definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: North Korea has really boxed them in.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜真的是让他们犯难。

sentences.english: He has entertained the world with stories of a daring2 archeologist.
sentences.chinese: 他以一位敢于冒险犯难的考古学家的故事娱乐全世界。

sentences.english: Youth means the predominance of courage over timidity, of adventure over the love of ease.
sentences.chinese: 青春意味着勇气胜过胆怯，冒险犯难胜过贪图安逸。

sentences.english: He was torn between his duty and his better instincts.
sentences.chinese: 他在选择尽职责和凭直觉更应当怎么做之间犯难了。

sentences.english: Outside of China, even staff have trouble pronouncing its name.
sentences.chinese: 在中国以外，工作人员甚至为公司名称的发音犯难。

definition: to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
